30023.name: Coast to Coast Walk
30023.description: In three stages you walk through landscapes shaped by 600 years of Māori occupation, and through some of our finest natural and built heritage areas offering panoramic views along the way.

1999648.name: Kaikoura Coast Track
1999648.description: private walk at the coast of Kaikoura

2865325.name: Borland Lodge to North Borland Hut

2865327.name: Borland Road to Lake Monowai Car Park

2865331.name: Lake Monowai Car Park to Rodger Inlet

2865335.name: South Borland Track to Borland Road Gate

6048254.name: Temple Basin
6048254.note: no DoC trampimng website found. Edicational site for the basin itself exists.
6048254.description: path nr.35 from Rother Wanderführer, Neuseeland

6048349.name: Avalanche Peak
6048349.description: path nr.36 from Rother Wanderführer, Neuseeland

6048389.name: Mount Bealey
6048389.description: path nr.37 from Rother Wanderführer, Neuseeland

6048416.name: Mount Aicken
6048416.description: path nr.38 from Rother Wanderführer, Neuseeland

6050920.name: Roberts Point
6050920.description: path nr.30 from Rother Wanderführer, Neuseeland

6050926.name: Alex Knob
6050926.description: path nr.31 from Rother Wanderführer, Neuseeland

6050941.name: Lake Matheson
6050941.description: path nr.32 from Rother Wanderführer, Neuseeland

6050963.name: Mount Fox
6050963.description: path nr.34 from Rother Wanderführer, Neuseeland

6054911.name: Mount Iron
6054911.description: path nr.47 from Rother Wanderführer, Neuseeland

6054949.name: Roys Peak & Mount Alpha
6054949.description: path nr.48 from Rother Wanderführer, Neuseeland

6057092.name: Rocky Hill
6057092.note: did not find a Doc reference
6057092.description: path nr.49 from Rother Wanderführer, Neuseeland

6057127.name: Queenstown Hill
6057127.note: did not find a Doc reference
6057127.description: path nr.51 from Rother Wanderführer, Neuseeland

6057138.name: Rob Roy Glacier Lookout
6057138.description: path nr.50 from Rother Wanderführer, Neuseeland

6059845.name: Ben Lomond
6059845.description: path nr.52 from Rother Wanderführer, Neuseeland

6062281.name: Cowans Hill
6062281.description: path nr.40 from Rother Wanderführer, Neuseeland

6062291.name: Mueller Hut
6062291.description: path nr.42 from Rother Wanderführer, Neuseeland

6170321.name: Te Ara Hura
6170321.description: Collection of walks to explore Waiheke Island and discover its natural beauty. On Te Ara Hura walking track network you can explore the coastline, pass through native bush and visit historic sites. There's a range of walks, from short and easy through to

6204706.name: Mount Ollivier
6204706.description: path nr.43 from Rother Wanderführer, Neuseeland

6204716.name: Hooker Valley Track
6204716.description: path nr.44 from Rother Wanderführer, Neuseeland

6204719.name: Ball Hut
6204719.description: path nr.45 from Rother Wanderführer, Neuseeland

6207453.name: Bealey Spur Hut
6207453.description: path nr.39 from Rother Wanderführer, Neuseeland

6207460.name: Key Summit
6207460.description: path nr.54 from Rother Wanderführer, Neuseeland

6207478.name: Mount Luxmore
6207478.description: path nr.57 from Rother Wanderführer, Neuseeland

6207512.name: Lake Manapouri Circuit
6207512.fixme: source of this is given as bing - yet it cannot be seen in bing!
6207512.description: path nr.58 from Rother Wanderführer, Neuseeland

6207586.name: Punakaiki - Pororari River Loop
6207586.description: path nr.28 from Rother Wanderführer, Neuseeland

6207597.name: Ballroom Overhang
6207597.description: path nr.27 from Rother Wanderführer, Neuseeland

6215093.name: Mount Robert Circuit
6215093.description: path nr.25 from Rother Wanderführer, Neuseeland

6215100.name: Mount Arthur
6215100.description: path nr.23 from Rother Wanderführer, Neuseeland

6594589.name: Tararua - northern crossing
6594589.description: Northern Crossing links the Ōhau and Waingawa catchments in Tararua Forest Park - one of four classic tramps here - 3 to 5 days - expert route

6594628.name: TAR - southern crossing
6594628.description: 1 of 4 classics links Otaki and Tauherenikau catchments. Originally from Otaki Forks to Wairarapa Plains and now the Kaitoke Basin. It was popularised from the 1920s by the Tararua Tramping and other clubs in the Hutt Valley and Wairarapa.

6898718.name: C360f Avonhead Gardens
6898718.description: Between McLeans Island and Avonhead Park is NOT signed. The C360 signed portion is from Avonhead Park to Riccarton Bush follows the Avon and is a mix of housing, university and bush.

7212937.name: Dusky Track - Supper Cove Hut variation

8522411.name: Te Araroa - NI Low tide
8522411.description: Low tide alternative routes for Te Araroa

8524772.name: Foggy Peak - Castle Hill Peak Traverse

9079665.name: Ara Tawa
9079665.operator: Wellington City Council from Takapu Road Station to Kenepuru Station and Porirua City Council from Kenepuru Station to mouth of Porirua Stream
9079665.description: A shared path for runners, walkers and cyclists. A central section, from Tawa Station to Findlay Street mainly uses residential roads. The north and south sections, both of about 2 km each follow a purpose built dedicated way.

9085268.name: Lawson's Track
9085268.distance: Mark to Picnic = 1.0 km, Picnic to Colchester = 1.0 km, Picnic to Bushland = 0.5 km
9085268.description: Through Seton Nossiter Park from Mark Avenue (between Granada and Paparangi) to Bushland Grove, Paparangi and Colchester Crescent, Woodridge

9085280.name: Lawson's Track - Picnic to Bushland Grove
9085280.description: off shoot from ex Lawson's Track from Mark Avenue, Grenada to Colchester Crescent, Woodridge

9192370.name: Mount Te Kinga Track/Ara O Te Kinga

9229284.name: Te Awa River Walk
9229284.description: Te Awa, caters to people of all ages and abilities and was designed for both cyclists and pedestrians. The path is generally 3m wide, flat and made of concrete but does include a couple of very short but steep hills

9286961.name: Skyline Walkway
9286961.description: This track runs from Johnsonville south west to Makara Saddle, Karori. Allow up to 5 hours to traverse 12kms of Wellington’s ridge tops following the Outer Green Belt

9337472.name: Burttons Track
9337472.description: Burtton's Track (Scotts Road to Mangahao Road) lies between Palmerston North and Shannon.

9338483.name: Burttons Track access
9338483.description: an extension to show access to Burttons Track - from the south east end of Fitzherbert Avenue, Palmerston North to the south end of Scotts Road and the start of Burttons Track.

9338495.name: Mangahao - Manahika Track
9338495.description: The Mangahao Makahika Track connects Burtton's Track, which lies between Palmerston North and Shannon, with the Arapaepae Lookout Trail near Levin.

9339948.name: Holdsworth - Kaitoke extension
9339948.description: walking route from Masterton to start of Holdsworth - Kaitoke Track

9373454.name: Hutt River Trail west
9373454.description: Hutt River Trail west starts at the mouth of the Hutt River, follows the right (west) bank to Birchville. Currently there is a gap between the entrance to Manor Park Golf Club and Silverstream Bridge. Hutt City have a plan to complete this section.

9373455.name: Hutt River Trail east west connections
9373455.description: various connections between east and west banks of the Hutt River

9380084.name: Te Araroa alternative route
9380084.description: Alternative to avoid 1) rahui at Okura Bush Walkway to assist Kauri die back issue and 2) low tide alternatives. This route follows an arterial road with moderate traffic flows and narrow shoulders in places.

9381759.name: Puhoi Lookout Track
9381759.description: a circular route starting across the bridge from the T intersection of Saleyards Road, Ahuroa Road and Puhoi Road.

9382417.name: Greytown Woodside Shared Trail
9382417.description: follows the line of the abandoned railway (c1954) from the current Woodside Station on the Wairarapa Line to Cotter Street, Greytown

9414967.name: Remutaka Rail Trail - alternative access
9414967.description: 'normal' start point is Maymorn Station.  This alternative begins at the end of the Hutt River Trail.  This can offer a continuous experience

9415758.from: Plateau Road, Te Marua and SH2
9415758.name: Remutaka Rail Trail
9415758.description: The route published by GWRC is from Kaitoke car park to Cross Creek car park. To make a network the creator has added access at the end of Hutt River Trail, Te Marua to Kaitoke car park and from Cross Creek car park to Featherston.

9417644.name: Bothamley (shared) pathway
9417644.description: Running alongside the Kenepuru Stream, this pathway is on its way to become the ‘green heart of Porirua’ thanks to an environment development programme. The wide gravel track passes through mature exotic trees and regenerating natives and is a great ‘bug

9418279.name: Bothamley Pathway - access from Warspite Ave

9418283.name: Bothamley Pathway - access from Champion Street

9418284.name: Bothamley Pathway - access from Bellona Place

9420111.name: Southern Walkway
9420111.description: 11 km walk between Oriental Bay and Island Bay: 4–5 hours. Steep in places, not difficult overall: average fitness. Features tranquility of the Town Belt forest, and the rugged coastline between Houghton Bay and Island Bay.

9421443.name: Polhill Reserve loop shared way
9421443.description: Starts near the Aro Street bus terminus (50 m asl) the path wends south and west up to Polhill (250 m asl).  The descent, skirting the Zealandia fence line, is to George Denton Park (top of Highbury) then to Holloway Road and back to Aro Street.

9441474.name: Te Araroa - 06 Wellington - a Poads Road, Levin to Otaki Forks

9441502.name: Te Araroa - 06 Wellington - b Otaki Forks to Waikanae

9442128.name: Manawatū Gorge Track
9442128.description: Walk through native bush, enjoy scenic views and experience native wildlife only a short distance from Palmerston North.

9444117.name: Te Araroa - 06 Wellington - c Waikanae to Paekakariki

9444588.name: Te Araroa - 06 Wellington - d Paekakariki to Elsdon Camp, Porirua

9448286.name: Te Araroa - 06 Wellington - e Elsdon Camp, Porirua to Lambton Quay, Wellington

9448532.name: Te Araroa - 06 Wellington - f Lambton Quay, Wellington to Shorland Park, Island Bay

9464721.to: Junction of SH1 (High St and SH3, Bulls
9464721.from: Wanganui Motor Boat Club ramp, Anzac Parade, Wanganui
9464721.name: Te Araroa - 04 Manawatū-Whanganui - g Whanganui to Bulls
9464721.description: Hazards Vehicles - take much care on SH3, and heading into Bulls Farming operations Forestry operations Track exposed to sun, wind or cold Few water sources

9464774.name: Te Araroa - 04 Manawatū-Whanganui - h Bulls to Feilding
9464774.description: Road margins all the way. Shoulders often minimal. Face the oncoming traffic (you on right side in Aotearoa-New Zealand), EXCEPT where: a) view ahead is restricted - drivers of you b) there is a footpath on the other side

9464775.name: Te Araroa - 04 Manawatū-Whanganui - j Feilding to Palmerston North
9464775.description: Road margins much of the way. Shoulders often minimal. Face the oncoming traffic (you on right side in Aotearoa-New Zealand), EXCEPT where: a) view ahead is restricted - drivers of you b) there is a footpath on the other side

9464986.name: Te Araroa - 04 Manawatū-Whanganui - k Palmerston North to Old West Road (SH57)
9464986.description: Road margins much of the way. Shoulders often minimal. Face the oncoming traffic (you on right side in Aotearoa-New Zealand), EXCEPT where: a) view ahead is restricted - drivers of you b) there is a footpath on the other side

9466682.to: Poads Road on the outskirts of Levin
9466682.name: Te Araroa - 04 Manawatū-Whanganui - m Old West Road (SH57), Palmerston North to Gladstone and Poads Rds, Levin
9466682.description: Old West Road (SH57), Palmerston North to junction of Gladstone Road and Poads Road, Levin. Many short but steep (>10%) ascents and descents. Several streams to pass through.

9578580.to: Kerikeri - Stone Store and Kemp House
9578580.name: Te Araroa - 01 Northland - c Puketi campsite, Wairare Road to Kerikeri (Stone Store)
9578580.description: CLOSURES: Lambing (April 29 - September 14) (five months) Last weekend in February Occasional summer closures for clay mining ALTERNATIVE: Puketotara Road.

9579941.from: Kerikeri - Kemp House and Stone Store
9579941.name: Te Araroa - 01 Northland - d Kereikeri (Stone Store) to Waitangi Bridge
9579941.description: Te Araroa’s inaugural plaque revealed on 7 February 1995: a local volcanic stone embedded with lines from A R D Fairburn’s poem ‘To a Friend in the Wilderness’ I could be happy, in blue and fortunate weather, Roaming the country between you and the sun.

9579943.name: Te Araroa - 01 Northland - e Waitangi Bridge to Opua

9579999.name: Te Araroa - 01 Northland - f Opua to Waikare

9580795.name: Te Araroa - 01 Northland - g Waikare to Whangarei Heads
9580795.description: PARTS OF RUSSELL FOREST ARE AFFECTED BY KAURI DIEBACK DISEASE. PLEASE FOLLOW INSTRUCTIONS TO WASH BOOTS ON WAY IN AND WAY OUT OF FOREST. posted May 2019

9581607.name: Te Araroa - 01 Northland - j Cullen Brynderwyn Walkway
9581607.description: Cullen Road: Forestry traffic operates Mon-Sat 05h-16h Felling can occur near the road Please observe signage and traffic management instructions We recommend you wear hi-viz vest and/or pack covers

9581608.name: Te Araroa - 01 Northland - k Bream Tail to Mangawhai Heads
9581608.description: Tide information: Check the best times for walking on www.niwa.co.nz/our-services/online-services/tides

9590017.name: Te Araroa - 02 Auckland - a Mangawhai Heads to Pakiri Beach

9590262.to: cnr Govan Wilson and Matakana Valley Rds
9590262.name: Te Araroa - 02 Auckland - b Pakiri Beach to cnr Govan Wilson and Matakana Valley Rds

9590477.name: Te Araroa - 02 Auckland - c Govan Wilson Road to Puhoi Valley

9592415.name: Te Araroa - 02 Auckland - d Puhoi Valley to Puhoi

9592461.name: Te Araroa - 02 Auckland - e Puhoi to Wenderholm Kayak
9592461.description: The kayak route is open for 10 months (September to June) and is best down on an outgoing tide. At any time of the year you can walk to Wenderholm or close by Waiwera using the left fork (right coming north)

9596761.name: Te Araroa - 02 Auckland - g Stillwater to Long Bay
9596761.description: Okura Bush Walkway has a Rahui imposed on 10 May 2018 and reviewed and renewed on 12 Apr 2019. Continue on East Coast Road or ford at low tide. See alternative route for this.

9599093.name: Te Araroa - 02 Auckland - h Long Bay to Devonport

9606135.name: Te Araroa - 02 Auckland - k Onehunga to Puhinui
9606135.description: Cross the footbridge to Mangere foreshore and skirt around Auckland International Airport.

9606505.name: Te Araroa - 02 Auckland - m Puhinui to Totara Park, Wairere Road, Manurewa

9607154.name: Te Araroa - 02 Auckland - n Totara Park, Wairere Road, Manurewa to Bombay
9607154.description: Mainly urban roads to beyond Papakura. After than mainly open country with a hill to climb. This route follows the maps issued November 2018. An earlier route through the Hunua Ranges is now avoided as a result of Kauri die-back disease.

9614243.name: Te Araroa - 02 Auckland - s Bombay to Mangatawhiri
9614243.description: a route that avoids both SH1 and SH2 (except to cross over)

9615763.name: Te Araroa - 02 Auckland - t Mangatawhiri to Mercer
9615763.description: a route from Mangatawhiri to Mercer along Koheroa Road

9623297.name: Te Araroa - 03 Waikato - a Mercer to Rangiriri

9623302.name: Te Araroa - 03 Waikato
9623302.description: The Waikato was a source of life for Māori. We follow Waikato for 80 km to Hamilton (including Hakarimata ridge) and then the Waipa for 160 km to Pureora, diverting to ascend Pirongia (dominant on the skyline) and pass the spectacular Waitomo Caves.

9623412.name: Te Araroa - 03 Waikato - b Rangiriri to Huntly
9623412.description: Walkers are offered protection of the taniwha Tarakokomako. And told the names the seven now-vanished ancestral villages and the two existing marae en route. The plaque carved with a taniwha has a greeting from Tainui, the people of Waikato.

9623423.name: Te Araroa - 03 Waikato - c Huntly to Ngaruawahia
9623423.description: The Hakarimata Track is steep, hilly and arduous but the bush and views are worth it.

9623443.name: Te Araroa - 03 Waikato - d Ngaruawahia to Pukete Road, Hamilton
9623443.description: Ngaruawahia is the home of the Maori King and the magnificent Turangawaewae Marae. At Ngaruawahia two great rivers merge - Waikato and Waipa. These were important canoe routes and later served settlers.

9623483.name: Te Araroa - 03 Waikato - e Pukete Road to Taitua Arboretum, Taitua Rd, Hamilton
9623483.description: Hamilton's Taitua Arboretum is a collection of mature trees on 20 hectares of open pasture, lakes and woodland gardens linked by a network of walking tracks and bridges and features great views and wonderful bird life. Open 7 days from 8am to before dusk.

9626091.to: DOC picnic area, Limeworks Loop Rd
9626091.name: Te Araroa - 03 Waikato - f Waipa Walk
9626091.description: Footpaths, back road & SH road margins, pasture & river esplanade. HAZARDS: Vehicles Farm operations - please give way to farm animals; Bypass Waipa River Banks when in flood Respect private land NO dogs Kapamahunga path closed 1 Aug-10 Nov - lambing

9626240.name: Te Araroa - 03 Waikato - g Pirongia Traverse
9626240.description: Pirongia Weather conditions can change rapidly, especially at higher altitudes. Carry a change of clothing, wet weather gear and sufficient food to cater for any emergency.

9626289.name: Te Araroa - 03 Waikato - h Pirongia to Waitomo
9626289.description: Closed annually 1 Aug - 1 Oct for lambing

9626629.to: Shearing monument, Rora Street, Te Kuiti
9626629.name: Te Araroa - 03 Waikato - j Waitomo to Te Kuiti
9626629.description: Medium-grade tramp - farms and bush and a small portion of road margin. 150-metre ascents. Pause on high karsts to view King Country's low agriculture and tumbled limestone that rise to volcanic summits – north > Pirongia, east > Pureora, south > Ruapehu

9626654.from: Shearing monument, Rora Street, Te Kuiti
9626654.name: Te Araroa - 03 Waikato - k Te Kuiti to Barryville Road, Pureora Forest

9628502.name: Te Araroa - 04 Manawatū-Whanganui - a Pureora Forest Park to Taumarunui

9631595.name: Te Araroa - 04 Manawatū-Whanganui - c Tongariro Alpine Crossing

9631615.from: Mangatepopo Track turnoff, Tongariro National Park
9631615.name: Te Araroa - 04 Manawatū-Whanganui - d Mangatepopo to National Park

9631639.name: Te Araroa - 04 Manawatū-Whanganui - e National Park to Whanganui River
9631639.description: There are no facilities of any type at the Kurua-Retaruke Rd end of this track. Trampers need to be totally independent and make their own pre-arrangements for food, shelter or pick-ups.

9633806.to: Wanganui Motor Boat Club ramp, Anzac Parade, Wanganui
9633806.name: Te Araroa - 04 Manawatū-Whanganui - f Whanganui River
9633806.description: River transport is the only option from Mangapurua Landing to Pipiriki. Pre-book delivery of kayaks or canoes. Hazards: Capsize: limited places to exit onto bank Cycling: keep to the left and single file. Walking: narrow, winding, short sight lines ahead

9644590.name: Te Araroa - alternative Mangatawhiri to Mercer

9644683.name: Te Araroa - alternative Drury to Rangariri
9644683.note: This route is exclusively on well formed roads. Walk facing on-coming traffic (right hand side in Aotearoa-New Zealand) unless: 1) footpath on other side 2) bends mean sight-lines of on-coming traffic are not adequate
9644683.description: This alternative route avoids walking SH1 and SH2 after Bombay, and unformed paths Mercer and Meremere Shows flat farming country at its best.

10372194.name: Te Araroa - extreme weather alternative from Camp Elsdon, Porirua
10372194.description: an alternative in extreme weather to avoid being on an the exposed top of Rangituhi

10414430.name: Te Ara Utiwai
10414430.description: From Elsdon Camp (50 m asl) for about 6 km towards Rangituhi to 350 m asl. A further path continues to the top of Rangituhi. Bicycles can traverse in either direction for the first 2 km. Beyond that bicycles may only go uphill.

10414459.to: Spicer public car park, Broken Hill Road, Porirua
10414459.from: public car park, Elsdon Camp, Raiha Street, Porirua
10414459.name: Rangituhi Walk
10414459.description: Climb to the summit of this 468 m peak for views on clear day from the Inland Kaikoura Range (Tapuae-o-Uenuku 2,885 m) in the south to Taranaki (2,518 m) in the north-west - it's a good option for older children.

10559639.name: Pauatahanui Harbour circuit - a) Porirua to Pauatahanui

10559640.name: Pauatahanui Harbour circuit - b) Pauatahanui to Paremata Bridge

10559671.name: Pauatahanui Harbour circuit - c) Paremata Bridge to Porirua Station

10642358.name: Rakiura - north west circuit
10642358.description: Allow 9–11 days to walk the full 125 km circuit. This track is suitable for fit, well equipped and experienced trampers. Track times are an indication only and extra time should be allowed in adverse conditions.

10643081.name: Rakiura - southern circuit
10643081.description: Can add Southern Circuit to North West Circuit. Or get a boat to Freshwater or Freds Camp Hut. Southern Circuit is a remote, challenging tramping experience and requires a high level of fitness, good route-finding skills, and backcountry experience.

10992548.name: Te Araroa - 09 Canterbury
10992548.symbol: orange triangles, orange-tipped poles, and Te Araroa logos

10992549.name: Te Araroa - 10 Otago
10992549.symbol: orange triangles, orange-tipped poles, and Te Araroa logos

10992550.to: Stirling Point, Bluff (South Pole - 5,000 km away - might be visible on a clear day)
10992550.name: Te Araroa - 11 Southland
10992550.symbol: orange triangles, orange-tipped poles, and Te Araroa logos

11025812.name: Te Araroa Links, Alternates and Services

11544475.name: Mount Climie Track
11544475.description: The Mt Climie ridge provides the southern and eastern backdrop (and windbreak) to Upper Hutt.  It is also part of the long northern skyline of the Remutaka Range seen across the harbour from Wellington City.

11589483.name: Great Taste Trail (walking)
11589483.description: The trail (walkers and cyclists) has blue route markers: interpretive signs are located along the way and offers panoramic coastal and mountain views over Tasman Bay, Waimea Estuary and the Western Ranges, with many stops for fine food and relaxation.

11609058.name: Dun Mountain Trail - walking
11609058.description: Dun Mountain Trail follows New Zealand’s first railway (1862) bringing minerals from Wooded Peak. After a steady gradient to near Coppermine Saddle, the trail descends to Maitai Dam and follows the water supply pipeline in the lower Maitai Valley.

11620063.name: Hump Ridge Trail - 03 Port Craig to car park
11620063.description: located in the south east of Fiordland National Park, in the South Island of New Zealand. The track is about 61 km in distance and is based in Waitutu Forest (part of Fiordland National Park).

11620064.name: Hump Ridge Trail - 02 Okaka Lodge to Port Craig
11620064.description: located in the south east of Fiordland National Park, in the South Island of New Zealand. The track is about 61 km in distance and is based in Waitutu Forest (part of Fiordland National Park).

11620065.name: Hump Ridge Trail - 01 car park to Okaka Lodge
11620065.description: located in the south east of Fiordland National Park, in the South Island of New Zealand. The track is about 61 km in distance and is based in Waitutu Forest (part of Fiordland National Park).

11680889.name: Central Rail Trail
11680889.description: Otago Central branch started 1879 with 215 km done in 1907 by hardy souls using pick, shovel, dynamite, horse and cart: it transported supplies, wool and livestock. Road transport caused closure by 1990. Within 10 years a Rail Trail was started.

11769351.name: Big Bend Track
11769351.description: Starts where the Orongorongo Track reaches the river and progresses up the river for about 3.3 km.  At its end various other tracks start, including the Mount Matthews Track to 941 m asl.

11769352.name: Mount Matthews Track
11769352.description: Climbs steeply to top of Mount Matthews (941 m). Outstanding views of Wellington Harbour and Wairarapa, Tararua and Kaikoura ranges.

11772724.name: Whakanui Track
11772724.description: Whakanui Track: up the ridge between Whakanui Creek and Turere Stream and drops to Hine Road, Wainuiomata.

11781131.name: Te Araroa - 10 Otago - facilities
11781131.symbol: orange triangles, orange-tipped poles, and Te Araroa logos

12018914.name: Sanctuary to Sea
12018914.description: The Kaiwharawhara Stream is a large system with habitat for short jaw, banded and giant kōkopu and kōaro The route passes through Otari Bush, Churchill Drive and Trelissick Park to the Hutt Road and the entrance to the sea at Te Whanganui-a-Tara.

12118741.name: Putangirua Pinnacles
12118741.description: The Putangirua Pinnacles are a geological formation and a good example of “Badlands” erosion.  They are earth pillars or hoodoos located at the head of a valley on the south-west coast of New Zealand's North Island

12120473.name: Aorangi Crossing
12120473.description: The route is in five stages -

12149192.name: Otari-Wilton's Bush Loop
12149192.description: Otari-Wilton’s Bush is the only botanic garden in New Zealand dedicated solely to native plants. This unique plant sanctuary and forest reserve consists of 100 hectares of native forest and five hectares of plant collections.

12199407.name: Aro St - Ashton Fitchett walking track

12825570.from: Desert Road near Rangipo Intake Road
12825570.name: Waihohonu Track

12922584.name: HRT-e Te Aroha to Matamata (Hiking)
12922584.description: Views of the Kaimai Mamaku Maunga and the lush Waikato farmland. This section is under construction, in the mean time the roads may be a useful alternative.

12922612.name: HRT-d Paeroa to Te Aroha (Hiking)
12922612.description: Cross Awa Ohinemuri  and follow the original rail formation through lush framland with views of Re Aroha Maunga and Kaimai Maunga

12922798.name: PaWa Paeroa to Waihi Rail Trail (Hiking)

13386600.name: C360a Godley Cliffs
13386600.description: From just below the Mt Cavendish Gondola upper station to the seaside suburb Sumner. Evans Pass and the Godley Head carpark split the trail into approximate thirds, if you want to break a bit off the leg to make it easier to complete in a day.

13388326.name: C360h Sugarloaf Hills
13388326.description: Around 12 hrs for a typical walker - leg one to The Sign of the Kiwi 10 km 6 hrs - leg two to Sumner Beach 9 km - 5.45 hrs

13388436.name: Bridle Path
13388436.description: 1850: Canterbury's first European settlers from Lyttelton to Christchurch. Steep track. Stunning views from city to the Southern Alps and Lyttelton and Banks Peninsula. Several memorial seats, Stone shelter at top commemorates pioneer women of Canterbury

13392575.name: C360c Dunes Wetlands
13392575.description: The route includes the Burwood Red Zone, the wonderful Travis Wetland Nature Heritage Park, Bottle Lake Forest, and coastal dunes. About 6 to 7 hours. Queenspark entrance into Bottle Lake Forest is a useful place to break the leg in two.

13397937.name: C360d Brooklands Mouth
13397937.description: Spencer Beach Holiday Park to The Groynes, including Seafield Park, Brooklands Lagoon, Te Rauakaaka Reserve and the small villages of Brooklands, Stewarts Gully, and Kainga. 10 km - about 4 hours

13398061.name: C360e Waimakariri Braids
13398061.description: Waimakariri is a braided river, a very special river environment, and a home for some of our rarest birds. Check out the BRaid website, which explains in more detail the special ecology of our braided rivers and how we can protect it. Around 7 – 8 hrs.

13483090.to: Bus Stop Hobart Street at Broadway (near 3)
13483090.name: Airport Bus Stop walkway extension

13677819.name: Te Ara O Tipapa / Wetland Loop

14210977.to: ECNZ Track, Eastern Hill ridge, Lower Hutt
14210977.from: Te Whiti Park, Riverside Drive, Lower Hutt
14210977.name: Te Whiti Riser
14210977.description: This wide smooth trail follows a gentle gradient from Te Whiti Park in Waiwhetu to the ECNZ road at the top of the Eastern Hills.

15925355.name: Streamside Park Pathways
15925355.description: Beside Porirua Stream and Porirua Harbour from Kenepuru Station to Titahi Bay Road

15971574.name: Te Ara o Whareroa Shared Trail
